headline: Mayonnaise Biscuits
description: Mayonnaise biscuits are a Southern tradition. Made with just self-rising flour, milk, and mayo, they're light, fluffy, and absolutely delicious!
name: Mayonnaise Biscuits

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Stir flour, milk, and mayonnaise together in a large bowl until just blended. Drop 12 spoonfuls dough onto the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 12 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Awesome, my mom made these when I was a kid... After 15min had to lower temp. to 350 for 3 more min to get a clean toothpick... can add cheese, garlic and some old bay seasoning for some cheddar Bay Biscuits.
They’re good but the recipe needs salt. I cooked for 12 minutes then put the oven on low broil for a couple minutes because the tops weren’t brown but the bottoms were
No didn't make any changes probably exactly as it was said everything come out fine just plain gravy on top of them show me the fine breakfast. Thanks for sharing.
Working, let's see, in the gas oven now. 8:49. Too much mayo, I'll 1/2 the mayo. temp too high in gas oven lower to 350.

Turned out amazing. I added Italian herbs and garlic powder. I made 10 large ones. Definitely wait a bit for them to cool before handling as they are quite delicate. These would be amazing in strawberry shortcake
No

Been making biscuits like this my entire life, without the Mayo. Can't say how much better they are with those tablespoons of Mayo. Who knew! One thing though, if you want palm sized big fluffy biscuits then this recipe makes the classic 6 biscuits in a skillet. You will need to double the recipe for the 12. Try thyme for added yummy-ness. About a tablespoon of dried a little less of fresh. I do not believe there is a better herb to pair with any bread.
Great recipe, will make again.
very good biscuits will make these again may add a pinch of salt and sugar
Quick. Easy and yummy!!
Great recipe and my husband loved them! I prob used a bit more Mayo than required (my fav brand JFG) and put these ina sprayed muffin pan. Very fluffy with crispy bottoms!

Yes! Easy and tasty. Seriously makes me appreciated by all. I did use the muffin tin as read in the reviews. I made them easily before anyone else was up. Don’t forget to smudge some flour on you face and a little on your working space to dramatize “your hard work”.
These were super easy and less work than my usual recipe using shortening...which has been replaced with this keeper recipe! Thanks for sharing :)
Needs a little salt & then it’s perfect for quick & unplanned breakfasts!
Great exactly as written. I used full fat milk and Seriously Good mayo. Make sure you make 12 as any larger and they don’t cook in the middle.
The most tender ms fluffy biscuits I've ever made. Blew my buttermilk biscuits out of the water and way easier to make! The mayonnaise gives them a buttermilk like flavor. My new go to biscuit!
I added 2 tbps of Jalen juice, cheese and cilantro.....my husband fell in love !
Yummy yummy
These are my go-to biscuits. I really love the ease of making them. I also appreciate Evelyn's suggestion for substitute of rising flour as I never have any on hand. Thanks for posting!

These are the ones I make because they are the easiest, quickest and yummy. I don't use self rising flour so use 3 tsp baking powder and 1 tsp salt along with regular flour. Also, sometimes I throw in some dill.
This is the only biscuit recipe I have used since I found it! So easy and delicious!!!

I thought these were so easy and they turned out pretty well. I didn’t have self rising flour so I added 3 tsp baking powder and 1 tsp salt. I’d cut back a little on the salt next time. I gave it 4 stars only because I do taste and smell the mayonnaise. I used Best Foods. I think these would be amazing with cheese/herbs/garlic etc. I will definitely try them again. Thank you for the easy addition to my dinner tonight!!
Loved these! Used light mayo and 2% milk. Baked them in my silicone muffin pan. Absolutely no stick! Dunked them into some homemade chicken soup. So so good!

These are fantabulous!!! I followed the recipe exactly then added garlic powder, onion powder and cheddar cheese and topped them with garlic and parsley butter after baking and I no longer need Red Lobster in my life. seriously the best biscuits I have ever made. Thanks for the recipe
Wonderful and so easy to put together. Had them with main course salad. Will be making again. Easy to half the recipe for two people.
I made it with almond milk since I was out of milk and it STILL worked! CrZy easy

I am not a good biscuit maker so I won't comment other than to say I am still not a good biscuit maker! Easy instructions to follow but mine turned out with no flavor and could be used as paperweights!
Obviously easy to do. Took longer to pre heat the oven than to gather and mix ingredients.
Tasted salty! Easy recipe and would make again if not for that.
Very easy and perfect but a bit bland. Next time I'll add some honey.
These biscuits are easy to make and are really good!

Amazing biscuits! Incredibly easy to make too! I didn’t have any self rising flour so I added baking powder and a bit of salt to my flour, mixed it with a whisk, then whisked the mayonnaise in before adding the milk. The flour mixture was crumbly much like when you use lard or butter, but a bit softer. I was careful not to over mix when I added the flour. The biscuits were as light and fluffy as any biscuits I’ve made. I’ll definitely use this recipe again. For anyone that’s too intimidated to try making homemade biscuits, this is definitely a recipe to try.???

Made it exactly as written and it was great! Will be my go-to biscuit recipe from now on because I don’t like canned biscuits nor do I have time to make traditional biscuits with the ‘frozen butter’ and kneeding all that these days.
I made these for breakfast they are amazing with susage gravy my husband loves these
I absolutely love this recipe. Minimum ingredients are always in my fridge. I add Japanese herb SHISO. And spread shiso lemon butter on it. It is very soft as a soft buns and yammy:) Thanks.
This was my first time making biscuits from scratch, and I am very pleased with this recipe! It was simple, few ingredients and great results!
I’ve made these half a dozen times and they always come out great!
Very good and super easy to make!!
These are great the day of, but didnt stand up to being frozen and reheated. But worked great for us on day of!

This was my first attempt at making the biscuits. I usually don’t make substitutions when making a recipe the first time but I did not have self rising flour so I followed what other reviews said to do using all purpose flour, baking powder and salt. I rated this a 3 because it was too salty for me. I even used less than recommended.
Came out soft and light. Very good

I had never had biscuits with mayo and no buttermilk, but wow-oh-wow these were good! Very fluffy and moist inside, nice crust on the outside. I did cheat a little and added about 1/2 cheddar cheese and 2 Tbsp of parsley, but they didn't add that much flavor to what is already a really good biscuit! Family loved it!
These biscuits were very easy to make. They would be the perfect biscuit for a chicken pot pie filling to be poured over top.

I have made this for years.. it's delicious with gravy. I would only add to take heaping spoonful with alittle flour roll in hands put it in greased pan.i use alittle sausage or bacon grease drizzle on top of bisquits
 then bake..

With a family on a budget these biscuits saved the day. These are the easiest biscuits and they come out perfect and soft everytime. I spread butter on top when they come hot out of the oven. Yum! I think they will be a great base recipe for cheddar bay biscuits too. Will have to try that soon. Thanks for the recipe. I never buy store bought anymore!
Added teaspoon od salt, teaspoon of sugar and used buttermilk. Perfect
So yummy
Made these many times and they are light and delicious.
Best biscuits ever.

I was wary of this recipe, I don't have much luck with biscuits. I didn't have self rising flour so did as other reviewers suggested and also put vinegar in my milk to make it "buttermilk". Put them in a muffin tin and got RAVE reviews from my family.

I LOVE these biscuits! Made my first batch yesterday, and I am back at it today. I didn't have self rising flour so I used all purpose with the usual adjustments and also had only 1% milk so I used 1/2 a cup of it and 1/2 a cup of heavy cream. They were perfectly done in the 12 minutes the recipe stated. I know these will be a part of any meal I make where I need biscuits.

I made a double batch, and they are the best biscuits that I have ever made. I don't recommend using these biscuits for breakfast sandwiches though, because they are very soft and crumble easily, however they are perfect for biscuits and gravy. I will definitely be using this recipe again and again and again...
This is a great recipe.

I use this recipe as a base. These biscuits pair well with jam or with mixed in herbs and cheese. They aren't the rich standalone biscuits that you would eat without any toppings so I often pair them with meat or eggs. If you like rolled biscuits opt for a more standard buttermilk recipe. The drop version never disappoints.
Great biscuit recipe! I found these took near double the time to cook however I used a stone pan so it could account for extra time.

These are good, and we all like them. They go great with stew. I added 3 tsp. of baking powder and 1 tsp. of salt as the one review recommended if you don't have self-rising flour. They are very easy to burn though, so be careful.

These biscuits were delicious! I never have success making biscuits but these were super easy and came out perfectly. Make sure to use real mayonnaise, not miracle whip. I cut the mayo into the flour then added the milk. I ended up rolling out the dough, folding a couple times and patted it out with my hands before cutting out the biscuits. Then, I baked in a cast iron skillet. Thanks for sharing this recipe. It will definitely be my go-to biscuit recipe from now on!
My mom made these and they were terrible! What a waste of flour, now my siblings are blind. These biscuits are a plague upon our house. Thanks to these biscuits we all suffer from depression.
This is a family favorite of ours. Thank you for the recipe.

My SIL had bags and bags of self-rising flour in her cupboard so I wanted to used them up. This was awesome. The only thing is they are a bit salty for my taste. But I gave 5 stars because it was absolutely quick and easy to make and my family gobbled them up.

I just wanted to give this recipe a million stars. I have never made a biscuit before that was even close to edible. I made these exactly as written and they are perfect! Absolutely perfect! Who knew it could be so easy?
Great tasting!
Delicious!!! Added cheese and garlic and the whole family loved them

There are many biscuit recipes, and I've tried several that I like. So far, for taste, this one's the best. I did add about 1/3 cup finely shredded cheddar cheese, and curdled my milk with a couple teaspoons of vinegar. Used my hands, per one reviewer's suggestion, to lightly blend. Also brushed tops with melted butter and very light sprinkling of sesame seeds before baking. Baking time about right, turned out fluffy and delicious. Made 6 large biscuits. Thanks for posting.
This was the simplest biscuit recipe I have ever made. Absolutely delicious! I would recommend using a muffin pan instead of a baking sheet.
This has become my only biscuit recipe and I tell everyone about it! The search is over!!!
These biscuits turned out wonderful. This recipe is definitely a keeper.

These were delicious and extremely easy to make! They were very light and fluffy. The texture was just perfect. I put a little bit of cold butter in my mixture. My only tip is to make sure to not OVERMIX. My husband and son absolutely loved these biscuits. I will be using this recipe again!

made 1/2 a batch (gave me 14 biscuits), using the self-rising flour conversion from other reviewers. excellent. light and fluffy. not sure about a few reviews saying it was runny similar to pancake batter. mine certainly wasn't. very versatile. next time i might do cheddar, thyme and rosemary or cheddar and dill. great with the soups i make - hot and sour, clam chowder, tomato, won ton, french onion and beef/ barley.

Added 1/4 c Parmesan cheese, 1/4 tsp garlic paste, 1 1/2 tsp dried parsley and 1 tbsp baking powder as I don't have access to self rising flour in the Dominican Republic. As I live at sea level and high humidity, I had to bake an extra couple of minutes but the basic recipe is excellent.
Made this so many times ... Quick. easy, and delicious! Great combination for our home!!!
These biscuits are out of this world tasty...My family loved them...

Following the recipe exactly the batter was almost as wet as pancake batter. Still, I tried. I dropped a spoonful onto my parchment-lined baking sheet whereupon it immediately spread out into a flat disk. I had to add 4 more heaping TBS of flour into the bowl to get a nice wet drop biscuit consistency. Then they were perfect. Rose up high and fluffy, with a creamy, tender crumb. Biscuit perfection, although I felt they'd benefit from a little sugar and salt to round out the flavor. I used White Lilly Self-Rising flour, it really DOES make the best biscuits. If it wasn't so easy (and obvious) that the simple addition of extra flour will fix them, I'd give 1 star. But with more flour and my additions, I'd give 5 stars, so I'm settling on 4.

Created self-rising flour using the suggestion in comments which stated: 2 cups less 4 tsp. sifted flour, 3 tsp. baking powder, and 1 tsp. salt. Baked them in muffin tins instead of a baking sheet for 15 minutes. Nice results.

These turned out very well, concidering it was my first time ever making biscuits. I had to use all purpose flour because that's all I had on hand, 2 cups less 4 tsp. sifted flour, 3 tsp. baking powder, and 1 tsp. salt. I'm going to make these again.
These are some of the best biscuits I've ever made! The only modification I'd suggest is adding 1/2 tsp. sugar to the mixture, especially if serving them to the younger set.

I've been making these for years and it's never fail. The best easiest biscuits you can make. I should add, I still roll the dough into large balls and slightly flatten them before cooking. I hate the way drop biscuits look. It doesn't change the flavor obviously, but they look much nicer.

Just made this for breakfast and it was a hit, and in my family there is a lot of down south soul food cookers and this stood the test. Only thing different is I combined all dry ingredients and knead with hands and fold in milk slowly. Cooked them in a muffin pan also.

I was intrigued by the ingredients of these biscuits so I had to try them. I liked the soft, dinner roll-like texture but they had a bitter aftertaste. Perhaps the brand of mayo used was the culprit, Aldi's. I may try again with another mayo to see if it makes a difference.

I had previously saved this in my recipe box and tonight I needed a little something extra to go with dinner and thought about the mayonnaise biscuits recipe. So I whipped these up while everything else was cooking. 

I didn't have any self-rising flour, but I knew the recipe for making two cups of self rising flour, since I've done that many times before; simply combine 2 cups less 4 tsp. sifted flour, 3 tsp. baking powder, 1 tsp. salt. (Because I'm watching my salt intake, I only used 1/2 tsp. of salt.)

Since they're done in only 12 minutes, they were ready at the same time as everything else and they were delicious! Yes, I will definitely make this again!!

With just three ingredients and ready in only 12 minutes, these great tasting biscuits are great on their own and anytime. Tonight we ate them with just a pat of butter. Unfortunately we didn't have any leftovers. Think I'll make some for breakfast Sunday; they will be great with jam! (6/2/15)


UPDATE:

Well, I've made these a few more time. I consider these my "emergency biscuis" because they are quick and easy in a pinch or as a last minute add on to meal. 

I have also shared it with three or four people that say they "can't cook" or "don't know how make biscuits" and were surprised how easy the biscuits were to make and one lady's family couldn't believe she made homemade biscuits either. ?? (6/5/16)
This are great and have become my go to recipe for biscuits. I use olive oil mayo.

I've been baking biscuits for over 50 years and this is now my go to recipe. I mix the mayo into the flour with my fingers, add just enough milk till the dough sticks together and roll it out. The mayo creates a biscuit chemically similar to buttermilk biscuits - it provides the shortening and the vinegar in the mayo reacts with the milk.
One of my all time FAVS!! I use Miracle Whip instead of mayo though. You can even add shredded cheese!

Great recipe.I've made these several times and they always turn out great. Didn't have mayo in the fridge one day and used melted butter instead. Same great taste, the hubby didn't even notice a difference, and they are his favorite.
These are so good and moist. I have used this recipe many times. Yum!
These are the best biscuits ive ever made. Light and fluffy, and tastes great!!! Ive recommended this recipe to all my friends. Soooo simple to make. Love them.

I thought these were great. I used garlic salt and added onion powder. I drizzled a little butter over the top and let then rest about 10 minutes before I baked them. They came out fluffy and delicious. Forget that rolling and cutting nonsense,! I did use muffin tins to give them a shape.

These were really good, to me, but my partner, who's not a fan of mayo, claimed he could taste it. Possibly, but I've often found that when he doesn't know about the mayo, he likes things better :)! (He caught me, that time!) I really liked them, and they were easy. I made them a bit too small, I think; they didn't spread out much from the size of the mouth of the glass I usually use to cut biscuits. I'll make them bigger next time. One trick I use for biscuits that worked well with these is to roll out two layers, each half the depth specified, and place them one on top of the other before cutting the dough. The finished biscuits break apart easily to fill them. That worked well with this recipe.

These turned out great! Best biscuits I've made. I used 2 cups all purpose flour, then added 3 tsp baking powder n 1 tsp salt. Delicious! Next time I want to try adding some shredded cheese to the mix :) these reminded me of the biscuits from red lobster. My new favorite.

This biscuits are sooooo good! I use fat free mayo and skim milk. Those of you on WW 2 points and the are best biscuits! My family love these and get very excited when I am making them. My grandchildren beg for these when they are visiting! And so easy to make.
taste like its missing something.

This is now my go to recipe for biscuits! I have shared with everyone I know! They are quick, easy, and tasty! I sometimes add a pinch of sugar. You do not taste the mayo and it taste like you spend a while lot longer making "made from scratch" biscuits than you actually did. I highly recommend trying.
These are the best biscuits! My husband whisks the mayo in first to make the flour crumbled before adding the milk and they turn out perfect every time.

Amazing so easy to make and delicious!!!! Thank you for sharing this, I just made them for the 2nd time they are the best tasting biscuits I didn't change a thing, in answer to the Person that said the batter has a bad consistency, it sits up stiffer by the time you get them on the baking sheet. I almost didn't make them but so happy I did!

I was looking for a quick biscuit recipe to go along side chili and came across this one. The mayonnaise seemed a bit odd to me but I thought I would give it a try. Boy am I glad I did! These were so easy and absolutely delicious! Other reviewers have said they had no self rising flour, I found myself in the same predicament..so I reduced the flour by 4 teaspoons and added 1 teaspoon of salt and 3 teaspoons of baking powder. I also added about a cup of shredded cheddar cheese. they came out fluffy and delicious...so easy and so good! I will definitely be making these again, and often!
These are SO much easier than cutting butter into flour. Very tasty and super fast!
Delicious!! I used these biscuits as a substitute for buttermilk biscuits with gravy. So easy and yum!

You don't expect something this easy to be this good. I've had self-rising flour on hand from a previous recipe and this gives me a chance to use it up. I made these exactly as written and they were wonderful.
Great recipe! So yummy and light. Very easy without having to get your hands in them like with traditional biscuits. I just scooped them into a muffin tin with my scooper.
